result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay restitution or Court will enter a Civil Judgment.

60 days to pay costs.   If costs are not paid by due date the defendant may be required to serve 1 day jail for every $50.00 unpaid.

Defendant to reimburse FDL County for Attorney's fees.
AMENDED 5/23/16:  Atty fees due FDL County determined.

Huber, out of county travel, for work search, employment, treatment, granted at the discretion of  jail administration. 

Defendant shall complete Jail Check-In packet immediately. Jail staff shall contact the defendant within 72 hours of receiving JOC to set report date, which shall be within 60 days.

State law REQUIRES a DNA sample be provided for every criminal offense committed after April 1, 2015.
